intro: Hypericum connatum var. paraguariense, commonly known as the Paraguayan St. John's Wort, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate and simple, with a slightly serrated margin. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties.
